10.58.text:
>> Well I suppose I'm a
fairly average Australian.

13.96.text:
>> First and foremost
I'm a sister.

30.06.text:
I went from being
confused as a young person

35.17.text:
And, I really love
that teenager.

40.71.text:
>> Pretty wild and
out of control.

44.51.text: A lot of a party animal.

46.60.text: But also quite angry I think.

49.20.text:
Yeah, she seems like
a different person

50.96.text:
to the way I'm living
my life now.

52.86.text:
>> That younger woman is
always waiting for someone

59.87.text:
to say do this, do that,
dance for us, clear the table.

66.05.text:
>> I was hungry for all
sorts of experiences

70.23.text:
but perhaps not brave enough to
take some of those experiences

77.53.text:
>> Instead of embracing
my differences I hid them

88.31.text:
I was so full of angst and
not sure of where I was

96.82.text: >> I was very, very, very timid.

118.06.text:
Yeah, I think when you feel like
you should be a certain person

122.16.text:
and you fall short of
that, particularly,

126.93.text:
like as a young woman you
can feel really guilty.

143.05.text:
>> What would I say
to the angry teenager?

150.09.text:
It makes me quite weepy
thinking about it.

152.92.text:
Yeah, don't worry what
other people think of you.

156.44.text:
>> I would say to her you're
awesome and don't forget

160.30.text:
that you're awesome because
I think I didn't have enough

165.28.text: people telling me I was awesome.

167.07.text:
>> I'd just say don't
get too carried away

175.62.text:
Like if you just go for what
you want usually people respect

178.91.text:
And I wish I had known
that a lot earlier.

181.68.text:
>> I just think you've got
to be really true to yourself

183.48.text:
and never get yourself put into
a position where you're trying

187.93.text:
>> I should listen to
the voice in the back

189.77.text:
of my head a lot more than I do,
but then I always end up being

193.90.text:
like well, I told you so
and you should've listened.

196.44.text:
>> And when you're in a
world that bombards you

199.19.text:
with so many messages about
how untrustworthy you are

201.92.text:
or frivolous or unimportant
or somehow secondary,

210.53.text:
it's quite a tragedy
that women have to go

212.95.text:
through so much self-doubt
just to exist.

219.89.text:
that any woman can have I
think are a circle of people

225.13.text:
who understand you
and value you,

227.29.text:
who can say to you
you're being ridiculous,

230.51.text: of course you could do that.

232.59.text:
What do you mean that wasn't
good enough, yes it was.

235.02.text:
>> Sometimes you can do
something that you think oh wow.

238.76.text:
Pat yourself on the back or give
yourself a cuddle, you know,

244.03.text:
because you may be the only
one there that can do that.

247.10.text:
>> Yeah, I think we need
to have more dialogue.

249.09.text:
We need to hear more
female voices.

251.15.text:
>> I really admire younger women
because I see them doing things

255.46.text:
that to me are terribly
complicated.

258.03.text:
And I just think they just
do these things so well.

262.14.text:
>> I think one of the cool
things about being a woman is

268.81.text:
that you have other women to
kind of remind you of the fact

272.11.text:
that you should like
listen to yourself

275.82.text:
and that your ideas are
good and they're valid

279.32.text:
and they're worth
exploring if nothing else.
